result.markdown:
--- title: "Spring 2023 Workshop Survey Responses" author: "Seth Erickson" date: 2023-05-23 editor: visual format: html: df-print: kable --- ## Combined Workshop Survey Responses ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") # list of workshop IDs to filter results workshops <- c("2023-04-25-ucsb-git", "2023-05-16-ucsb-python") results <- read_csv("data-joined/all_workshops.csv") %>% filter(workshop %in% workshops) ``` ::: ## Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(dept_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(dept_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(dept_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_select.pre | count| |:---------------------------|-----:| |Bren/Environmental Sciences | 7| |Biology/EEMB/MCDB | 6| |Geography | 5| |Other | 5| |Chemistry | 3| |Engineering | 3| |Probability and Statistics | 3| |Biomedical/Health Sciences | 2| |Computer Science | 2| |Earth Sciences | 2| |Library | 2| |NA | 2| |Feminist Studies | 1| |Interdisciplinary Studies | 1|
::: ::: ### "Other" Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(dept_other.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_other.pre | count| |:-----------------------------|-----:| |NA | 30| |BMSE | 1| |IGPMS (Marine Science) | 1| |Marine Science (IGPMS) | 1| |Mathematics | 1| |Psychology and Brain Sciences | 1|
::: ::: ## Occupation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(occupation.pre) %>% separate_rows(occupation.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(occupation.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|occupation.pre | count| |:------------------------------------|-----:| |Graduate Student | 19| |Undergrad Student | 5| |Faculty | 2| |Postdoc Researcher | 2| |Research Staff/Researcher Programmer | 2| |NA | 2| |Admin Staff | 1| |Analyst | 1| |Librarian or Archivist | 1| |Support Staff/Technical Support | 1|
::: ::: ## Motivations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(motivation_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(motivation_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(motivation_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|motivation_select.pre | count| |:----------------------------------------------------------|-----:| |To learn new skills | 30| |To learn skills that I can apply to my work in the future | 29| |To learn skills that I can apply to my current work | 25| |To learn skills that will help me get a job or a promotion | 17| |To refresh or review my skills | 9| |Satisfy requirement for my program or current position | 2| |NA | 2|
::: ::: ## Hopes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, hopes.pre) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |hopes.pre | |:----------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Confidence and conceptual understanding of git. I am using it in my work but am finding my self taught ability with it is shaky and confused. I am hopeful that having someone experienced explain/answer questions will give me better understanding. | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |I'd like a refresher/good foundation so I can really solidify my skills. | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Understanding git version control and management. | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Annotated version control and general organization habits for codes | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Some basic understanding of python | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Data analysis skills | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |How to use github to organize and share my data/scripts | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Improve my usage of git and github | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I would like to go into research so I would just like to familiarize myself with the types of programming available to gain/apply to future jobs skills. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Making batch plots easier | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I want to get to know Pandas. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Exposure to coding in Python | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I have programmed in many things but not python or R, would like to level up | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Data manipulation and remote sensing | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Hopefully more knowledge in how to pull data from data sets and to make those reports reproducible. Also find better ways to present the data. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |The basics of working with data in Python | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I hope to refresh my programming skills and lean new ones as they are applicable to my current lab manager position and future phd research. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I hope to learn the basics of python so that I can use this as a foundation for building further python skills related to my work. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I'd like to be able to generate simple code that provides me the ability to make my own plots or analyze my data. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Basic python skills, familiarity with coding in general | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |To understand data formats in python, how to read/work/write matrices, vectors etc. If possible, also to understand and learn how to work with geographical data in formats of raster and vectors. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |how to use python | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |a bit about using python | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |syntax for Python |
::: ::: ## Applying the material ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_apply.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_apply.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_apply.post | count| |:----------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Neither Agree or Disagree | 2| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 2| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Somewhat Disagree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 2|
::: ::: ## Comfortable in the workshop environment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_comfortable.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_comfortable.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_comfortable.post | count| |:----------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Got clear answers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_clearanswers.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_clearanswers.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_clearanswers.post | count| |:----------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 3|
::: ::: ## Instructors were enthusiastic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_enthusiasm.post | count| |:----------------------|:---------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 3| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 3|
::: ::: ## Comfortable interacting with instructors ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_interaction.post | count| |:----------------------|:----------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 4| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Instructors were knowledgeable ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_knowledge.post | count| |:----------------------|:--------------------------|-----:| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Somewhat Agree | 2| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Strongly Agree | 3| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Instructor interaction example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, instructor_example.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |instructor_example.post | |:----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |both the instructors and helpers helped me solve problems on my computer promptly. i really appreciate it! | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |They helped me solving errors that I found and answering questions in general | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Gave many opportunities for questions and requested feedback on topics that should be covered in more depth | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I liked that Seth stayed on script, so that if I got behind I could go to the lesson plan to copy and paste code if I got behind for whatever reason. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |They were very responsive, giving clear answers and stimulating us to explore the tools (test the coding logic etc) | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Great humor from Dr. Frew and clear examples from all instructors! |
::: ::: ## Workshop Strengths ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_strengths.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_strengths.post | |:----------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |the instructions are clear and I am able to get an overview of git, which i could not understand before attending the workshop | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Hands-on, simple, objective. Good descriptive webpages and well-documented step-by-step | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Being in person was very nice for technical help. I like the sticky note system. | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |'- Learning the basics of Python and comparing the similarities and differences in keywords and syntax to other languages; - Learning some of the benefits of shortcuts or efficiencies in Python compared to other languages; - The notes to have access to later on.; ; | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Being hands-on, but also having a 'key' posted so we can follow if we lose track | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Clear, well explained background on python - well designed lesson materials - comfortable pace - easy to ask questions and extend materials as needed |
::: ::: ## Ways to improve the workshop ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_improved.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_improved.post | |:----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |I can't think of any right now | |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Some instructors and etxra help were in and out at variable times. Mac vs PC differences | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |'- If unique code is provided that is not in the lesson plan notes, add it to a second shared doc so attendees can access it as the teachers moves on, scrolling out of view the unique introduced code. Or share, other than via the big screen, a view of the instructor's code as they write it. ; | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |I cannot think of anything right now | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |miss the old workshops with sandwiches!!! but generally this was amazing, would take another (part 2 with more advanced materials??) | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Less back and forth between different windows--could be improved by writing the lessons into the scripts that is filled out as we go (one of the modules was like this and felt much easier to follow along) |
::: ::: ## Topic Suggestions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, suggest_topics.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |suggest_topics.post | |:----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2023-04-25-ucsb-git |Using Google Earth Engine through Python and/or R | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |Spatial analysis in Python! Using Python (in Google Colab, for example) and Google Earth Engine to do some spatial analysis using satellite images, reanalysis data etc | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |see prev answer - more python content | |2023-05-16-ucsb-python |more in-depth/dedicated workshop for writing more complicated functions, for loops, if statements, while statements, etc |
::: :::
